other_tests.findings: Increased lymphocyte count of 49% in bronchoalveolar lavage fluid; cultures for bacteria and fungi, as well as acid-fast bacilli tests, were negative.

Diverse inflammatory cell infiltration mainly composed of lymphocytes in the alveolar septa, granulomatous infiltration of macrophages in the alveolar spaces and septa, diagnosed as granulomatous vasculitis. No necrosis observed, negative acid-fast and Grocott's staining.
